rename.from: MaxOS installation for 2.8.0 fails 'no mountable filesystem' in dmg file
rename.to: MacOS installation for ZAP 2.8.0 fails 'no mountable filesystem' in dmg file

body:
@securestep9 I've just tried this on my Mac mini and it works fine for me :/
Can you try downloading it again?
Whats the sha256 hash of the file when downloaded?
It should be: https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-admin/blob/master/ZapVersions-2.8.xml#L27

@psiinon aftre some digging the problem is potentially is in the fact that the file system in the ZAP_2.8.0 DMG is APFS (in ZAP_2.7.0.dmg filesystem is HFS+) making it incompatible with older MacOS - apparently this is easily fixed by adding '-fs HFS+' option when building the dmg like this:

`hdiutil create DMG_filename.dmg -fs HFS+ -srcfolder fooProject/bin/ -format UDZO -volname ProjectFoo`
Note to self - submit PR to add the option to https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/v2.8.0/buildSrc/src/main/kotlin/org/zaproxy/zap/distributions.gradle.kts#L240-L246
And regenerate the release with `./gradlew -PcreationDate=2019-06-07 distMac`
And update https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/blob/master/Casks/owasp-zap.rb with the new hash
The current 2.8.0 (8fe3c30411524a05d662c2a2d1e2762a43291db7c39b23963b7de0f259ab122c) build is working for macOS Mojave 10.14.4.

@securestep9 have you had a chance to try out the download?

For reference someone else has also just reported this via twitter: https://twitter.com/Jaymzu/status/1141686039691632640

Hey guys, 
Mojave 10.14.5 here
Q:tmp jay$ shasum -a 256 ZAP_2.8.0.dmg
8fe3c30411524a05d662c2a2d1e2762a43291db7c39b23963b7de0f259ab122c  ZAP_2.8.0.dmg
Q:tmp jay$ shasum -a 256 ZAP_2.8.0-HFS-test.dmg
95d8678443e90cd72996b3440ce3ef75a575ad5b36809b41f063c5a47c09dd9b  ZAP_2.8.0-HFS-test.dmg

LE: -HFS works. Apologies for the confusion earlier. Apparently I need to read those fine manuals on diskutil syntax ;)
@Jaymzu just to confirm, do you mean that just  ZAP_2.8.0-HFS-test.dmg worked or  ZAP_2.8.0.dmg did as well?

So, here's a funny story. Doubleclicking ZAP_2.8.0.dmg in finder spits out a window saying "no mountable filesystems"
Mounting it from command line (now that I learned how to do it ;) ), however, works. 
Q:tmp jay$ hdiutil attach ZAP_2.8.0.dmg
Checksumming Protective Master Boot Record (MBR : 0)
Protective Master Boot Record (MBR :: verified CRC32 $FD137690
Checksumming GPT Header (Primary GPT Header : 1)
 GPT Header (Primary GPT Header : 1): verified CRC32 $8FD5E2F4
Checksumming GPT Partition Data (Primary GPT Table : 2)
GPT Partition Data (Primary GPT Tabl: verified CRC32 $952E2B58
Checksumming  (Apple_Free : 3)
                    (Apple_Free : 3): verified CRC32 $00000000
Checksumming disk image (Apple_APFS : 4)
.....................................................................................................................................................
         disk image (Apple_APFS : 4): verified CRC32 $4AD503FE
Checksumming  (Apple_Free : 5)
                    (Apple_Free : 5): verified CRC32 $00000000
Checksumming GPT Partition Data (Backup GPT Table : 6)
GPT Partition Data (Backup GPT Table: verified CRC32 $952E2B58
Checksumming GPT Header (Backup GPT Header : 7)
  GPT Header (Backup GPT Header : 7): verified CRC32 $3AD9BB8E
verified CRC32 $7C5B065E
/dev/disk5          	GUID_partition_scheme
/dev/disk5s1        	Apple_APFS
/dev/disk6          	EF57347C-0000-11AA-AA11-0030654
/dev/disk6s1        	41504653-0000-11AA-AA11-0030654	/Volumes/OWASP ZAP

@Jaymzu thanks!
@thc202 @kingthorin think its ok for us to keep using the existing dmg but to add a footnote explaining how to use it from the command line on older versions of MacOS?
